comment:
A nice black and white photo of a person smoking. The framing is nicely done; it has breathing room on the right to bring more focus on the subject. The posing is interesting, slightly slanted for an aesthetic effect.
 
 What needs improvement is the focus of the photo. The right eye is sharper than the left eye, which should be the main focal point as it grabs the most attention. The smoke is also barely visible.
 
 To improve the photo, the photographer should check their gear to see if their lens is front/back focusing. Changing the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus could also work. And finally, a darker background could make the smoke more visible.

shooting_action.action: Improve the focus of the photo.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment mentions that the focus of the photo needs improvement, which implies the need for better focus during shooting.

shooting_action.action: Ensure the left eye is the main focal point.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment notes that the right eye is sharper than the left, suggesting the need to adjust focus to make the left eye the main focal point.

shooting_action.action: Check the gear for front/back focusing issues.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly advises checking the gear for front/back focusing issues to improve focus.

shooting_action.action: Change the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests changing the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus.

shooting_action.action: Use a darker background to make the smoke more visible.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests using a darker background to enhance the visibility of the smoke.

action_concat:
Check the gear for front/back focusing issues.
Change the aperture size to bring the entire face into focus.
Use a darker background to make the smoke more visible.
Improve the focus of the photo.
Ensure the left eye is the main focal point.
Make the smoke more visible.

comment:

 There is, however, a bit too much negative space on the left. Other than that, it looks solid.
 
 A bit of cropping can solve the excessive space, or you could clone the background on the right with a photo editor so there is more space where the man is facing.

editing_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests using a photo editor to clone the background on the right to adjust the composition.

action_concat:
Crop the image or clone the background to reduce negative space on the left.
Reduce negative space on the left.

A happy shot of three men trying to jump in unison. Beautiful blue tones fill the screen with the snow and cloudless sky. It looks like an ordinary snap of tourists not really caring much about composition and technicalities of photography.

comment:
Wide-angle photograph of the aurora borealis set against the foreground of a lake pier with boats. The photograph appears to be shot hurriedly with an in-camera flash, illuminating the boats unflatteringly.
 
 The quality of the shot is poor and riddled with noise from the high ISO setting. It's best to reshoot the scene with better settings. Since the foreground will inevitably be silhouetted anyway, expose for the sky with as minimal ISO as the camera can handle, shot on a tripod. It's okay to keep the shutter speed a bit slower to let in more light, unless the aurora borealis is moving too fast and you don't want any light streaks; then you can opt for a faster shutter speed. Once you have a good shot of the sky, you can optionally expose for the background, shoot long exposures of the lake to keep as much light as you can, and even play around with light painting to illuminate the boats. 
 
 Now, having two photos with varying exposures, blend them altogether in post so that you can keep the well-exposed shot of the sky and, finally, a well-exposed shot of the foreground.

editing_action.action: Blend photos with varying exposures in post-processing.
editing_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests blending photos with different exposures in post-processing to achieve a well-exposed image.

shooting_action.action: Use a tripod to stabilize the camera.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests using a tripod to stabilize the camera for better exposure.

shooting_action.action: Expose for the sky with minimal ISO.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly advises exposing for the sky using the lowest ISO possible to reduce noise.

shooting_action.action: Adjust shutter speed based on aurora movement to control light streaks.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly mentions adjusting the shutter speed to prevent light streaks if the aurora is moving fast.

shooting_action.action: Avoid using in-camera flash to prevent unflattering illumination.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment implies that the in-camera flash caused unflattering lighting, suggesting it should be avoided.

shooting_action.action: Reduce noise by using a lower ISO setting.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment implies that high ISO caused noise, suggesting a lower ISO should be used.

shooting_action.action: Expose for the background and use long exposures and light painting.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests exposing for the background and using long exposures and light painting to illuminate the boats.

action_concat:
Reshoot the scene with better camera settings.
Expose for the sky with minimal ISO and use a tripod.
Adjust shutter speed based on aurora movement to control light streaks.
Expose for the background and use long exposures and light painting.
Blend photos with varying exposures in post-processing.
Avoid using in-camera flash to prevent unflattering illumination.
Reduce noise by using a lower ISO setting.

A saturated long exposure of a waterfall drops down several layers of rocks towards a small river. The extremely vibrant greens and browns make the viewer question whether this photo is real. The whites of the water are heavily subdued, while most signs of shadow are lifted too high, making the image appear like an illustration.
 
 Overly saturated photos can appeal to some people, but not many. While the composition looks fine, the movement of the water is captured well, the colors and the processing work appears overdone. One is reminded of the results of High Dynamic Range (HDR) photography and these results a likely to be the result of such filter or processing. It's recommended to stay away from HDR for now as it's very easy to overcook the images this way.

This is a blurry photograph of a sunset sky with two planes overhead. The presence of two planes at a low elevation suggests this shot may have been taken near an airport runway. The photographer could possibly be a hobbyist trying to do a panning shot of a plane over a sunset sky.
 
 Panning shots are usually taken with the subject clear in the frame. This shot appears too far away, taking in too much of the uninteresting landscape. It's recommended to keep a firm grip on the camera, carefully aim at the subject, and gently squeeze the shutter (low shutter speed) as the plane moves past. This may require many attempts.

The image captures scoleciphobia, the fear of wriggly things or worms in general. What appears to be an art piece may invoke emotions of fear and discomfort in some people, as the violent wiggling makes it appear like leeches or malicious tentacles. Apparently, this was an art piece by Dale Chihuly entitled "Fiori," or flowers. But despite its innocent name, the alien-like figures resemble parasites, and the vibrant colors suggest a venomous snake.
 
 There's more to this art piece in the frame. It's recommended to either take in all the figures in one frame, or keep this frame as is as a close-up, but remove the cut-off piece to the upper right so it's less distracting.

A photograph of a woman smiling towards the camera. She wears a beaded necklace and a strapless dress with a geometric design. The sky behind her is blown out; it's a brightly lit day.
 
 In front of her are dry plants and twigs. These remnants of old plant life look like long insect legs. A watermark of the photographer is visible at the bottom left edge of the photo.
 
 The problem with the photo is its focus. The focus point went directly to the twig right in front of the woman's face. This happens a lot when the camera mistakenly locks onto the wrong subject. So, when taking shots like these where the face is partially obscured by plants or other thin objects, always double-check the preview screen to ensure you've nailed the shot.

shooting_action.reasoning: The comment highlights the issue with the focus being on the twig instead of the woman's face, implying the need to improve focus on the intended subject.

comment:
Pictured here is a woman posing on top of a curvy tree. The curved tree provides a sense of dynamics, as it seems to suggest looking for the curves of the woman beside it. The pose looks relaxed, but since it's taken from below, the perspective shows more of her chin while also making her behind appear a bit bigger. The lighting in that area is also lacking; the shade doesn't give enough light to her face, and looking downward makes it worse.
 
 Recommendations are as follows:
 
 1. Angle her head to look a bit more toward the sky. This will light up her face more and reduce the double chin.
 2. Her left hand is resting flatly on her hip. Have her open or bend her fingers more so it doesn't appear massive.
 3. Her right hand is much too lit by the sun. Ask her to lower that hand a bit so it won't be overexposed.
 Optionally, the photographer can also shoot on top of a stool or ladder, so the model won't have to angle her head.

shooting_action.reasoning: The action is explicitly stated as a recommendation to improve the lighting on the model's face and reduce the appearance of a double chin.

shooting_action.reasoning: The action is explicitly stated to adjust the model's hand position to avoid overexposure.

shooting_action.reasoning: The action is explicitly stated as an optional recommendation to change the camera position for a better angle.

shooting_action.action: Adjust the shooting angle to minimize the appearance of the chin and behind.
shooting_action.reasoning: The action is implied by the comment on the perspective showing more of her chin and making her behind appear bigger.

shooting_action.action: Improve lighting on the model's face to avoid shadows.
shooting_action.reasoning: The action is implied by the comment on the lighting being lacking and the shade not giving enough light to her face.

action_concat:
Angle the model's head to look more toward the sky to light up her face and reduce the double chin.
Have the model open or bend her fingers on her left hand to avoid it appearing massive.
Ask the model to lower her right hand to prevent overexposure.
Shoot from a higher position using a stool or ladder to avoid the model having to angle her head.
Adjust the shooting angle to minimize the appearance of the chin and behind.
Improve lighting on the model's face to avoid shadows.

comment:
A complicated photo of what appears to be an engine. It looks modified and stylized for a show or performance. The vibrant blue goes well with the chrome, and the chaos of wires is subdued with the similar blue colors all around.
 
 The image appears soft, possibly out of focus even for what looks like a daytime photo out in the sun. Retaking this shot is better than trying to fix the lost details in post. Set a tighter aperture like f/4 or f/8 to cover more details, just don't go any slower than 1/60 or 1/100 of a second so as not to introduce camera shake. If the engine is running and vibrating, then set a higher shutter speed to freeze everything.

Use a tighter aperture like f/4 or f/8 and maintain a shutter speed of at least 1/60 or 1/100 to avoid camera shake.

comment:
Another bad HDR (high dynamic range) work. The outlines of the halos encircling our subjects, like an otherworldly aura, stick out as the grungy-looking dark sky contrasts with unusually bright patches of landscape below. Many parts of the landscape aren't even well-lit; the trees flicker from silhouettes back to normally lit trees.
 
 The photographer at least made sure that the horizon is straight. A reshoot of the entire scene is better than trying to fix all these image anomalies from excessive use of HDR.

 Evident on the sides of the pine trees on the left edge of the photo are chromatic aberrations. These are purple fringes or outlines that affect certain camera lenses.
 
 Using any photo editing tool or a RAW editor, there are tabs in its camera RAW functions that specifically deal with that artifact. Simply select it and use the slider until the purples vanish completely.

comment:
A colorful photograph of a landscape under a bridge shows another photographer working with their tripod in the sand. The sky looks almost like a rainbow with its vibrant hues of blue, red, green, and yellow. These otherworldly colors may have been caused by oversaturation or excessive use of HDR (high dynamic range), as white haloing is evident around the bridge. There was also an attempt to lift the already black details of the bridgepossibly to reveal the graffitimaking it less contrasty and unnatural.

To make the graffiti visible with the bridge and sky details, it's recommended to shoot this frame a few minutes later when the sun drops down enough so that the sky is no longer too bright for a long exposure shot. The sky then would no longer have blown out highlights, details of the darks would be lifted up, and you get vibrant sunset colors without the use of HDR as a bonus.

editing_action.action: Reduce oversaturation and excessive HDR use to eliminate white haloing around the bridge.
editing_action.reasoning: The comment implies that oversaturation and excessive HDR use caused white haloing, suggesting a need to reduce these effects in editing.

editing_action.action: Avoid lifting black details excessively to maintain natural contrast.
editing_action.reasoning: The comment implies that lifting black details excessively made the image less contrasty and unnatural, suggesting a need to maintain natural contrast in editing.

shooting_action.action: Shoot the frame a few minutes later when the sun drops down to avoid bright sky and achieve better exposure.
shooting_action.reasoning: The comment explicitly suggests capturing the image a few minutes later when the sun is lower to avoid bright sky and achieve better exposure, making it a shooting action related to timing.

action_concat:
Shoot the frame a few minutes later when the sun drops down to avoid bright sky and achieve better exposure.
Reduce oversaturation and excessive HDR use to eliminate white haloing around the bridge.
Avoid lifting black details excessively to maintain natural contrast.
